pieces

Class Pawn

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
      • pieces.Pawn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Pawn
extends pieces.Piece
    Representation of the Pawn piece in chess.
    Author:
    Sarah Squillace, Nikita Zala

    • Constructor Summary

      Pawn(char team, char type)
      Instantiates a Pawn object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FileRank getEnPassantLoc()
      Returns the FileRank location of where a Pawn on the opposing team would land after performing En Passant.
      boolean hasJustMoved2Squares()
      Returns a boolean for if the Pawn had moved two squares on the previous move, used for determining if En Passant can be performed.
      boolean isCapture(FileRank start, FileRank end)
      Returns true if this Pawn will capture a Piece on the enemy team.
      boolean isValidMove(FileRank start, FileRank end)
      This method returns true if the move from start to end is a valid move for this Piece.

      Sets the location of the Pawn that this Pawn will capture when performing En Passant
      void setJustMoved2Squares(boolean justMoved2Squares)
      Changes the boolean for if the Pawn had moved two squares on the previous move, used for determining if En Passant can be performed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pawn

        public Pawn(char team,
            char type)
        Instantiates a Pawn object
        Parameters:
        team - char ('b' if black, 'w' if white) representation of which color the Pawn is.
        type - the char representation of which type the Piece is, in this case, 'p'

    • Method Detail

      • getEnPassantLoc

        public FileRank getEnPassantLoc()
        Returns the FileRank location of where a Pawn on the opposing team would land after performing En Passant.
        Returns:
        a FileRank of the square behind it

      • setEnPassantLoc

        public void setEnPassantLoc(FileRank enPassantLoc)
        Sets the location of the Pawn that this Pawn will capture when performing En Passant
        Parameters:
        enPassantLoc - the FileRank location of the Pawn that will be captured

      • hasJustMoved2Squares

        public boolean hasJustMoved2Squares()
        Returns a boolean for if the Pawn had moved two squares on the previous move, used for determining if En Passant can be performed.
        Returns:
        true if the Pawn moved 2 squares on the previous turn, false if not.

      • setJustMoved2Squares

        public void setJustMoved2Squares(boolean justMoved2Squares)
        Changes the boolean for if the Pawn had moved two squares on the previous move, used for determining if En Passant can be performed.
        Parameters:
        justMoved2Squares - boolean value to change whether the Pawn just moved.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(FileRank start,
                           FileRank end)
        Description copied from class: pieces.Piece
        This method returns true if the move from start to end is a valid move for this Piece. It is an abstract method and its implementation differs depending on the type of piece.
        Specified by:
        isValidMove in class pieces.Piece
        Parameters:
        start - the FileRank location of the piece that is moving
        end - the FileRank location of where the piece aims to move.
        Returns:
        true if the move from start to end is valid by the rules of chess, false if not

      • isCapture

        public boolean isCapture(FileRank start,
                         FileRank end)
        Returns true if this Pawn will capture a Piece on the enemy team.
        Parameters:
        start - The FileRank representing the beginning of the move
        end - The FileRank of where the pawn will end on
        Returns:
        true if this move qualifies as a capture, false if not
